5 Out of our great love for you, and considering love as the reward, and with the intention of acquiring some immovable property free of charge without any reward from you, we have, as per the schedule below, acquired 108.88 sq m or 91.03 sq m of immovable property in Survey No. 149-2, Kongodu village, which was inherited by our ancestral father, namely, our father, Pulapakura Apparao Garu, and which is located in their possession and enjoy their full right of possession and enjoyment, without any written documents about the property. After them, our mother Pulapakura Satyavati also inherited the property intestate without any written documents. After the life of both of them, the property came to us as Class-1 heirs according to the Hindu Succession Act. We have constructed a new RCC basement in the property with our own money. The property is a property that we are enjoying with full right of possession. The property is hereby transferred to you free of charge without any consideration from you. We have taken physical possession of the property as per the schedule on this day itself. Therefore, from this date, you shall have all the full rights of donation, sale, and payment of all taxes in the property as per the schedule, and your sons and grandsons shall enjoy the happiness freely for the rest of their lives.
Therefore, regardless of any disputes arising from any feud or any other cause, we, our heirs, and our own expenses, will be able to freely transfer the property to you or your heirs according to this deed.
1. P. Venkata Ramana
2. M. Dhanalakshmi
3.K. DurgaSheet Endorsement

$3-3-
If the title to the Scheduled Property is required to be made effective to you, any amendment, supplemental document or other deed, as soon as you request We can register it in your name and give it to you in accordance with the regulations.
Apart from writing this settlement deed to you on this day for the property as per the schedule, this is an undisputed and uncontested property, free from any donations, purchases, agreements, mortgages, guarantees, etc., written or verbal, and free from any court transactions, and that there are no other heirs, claimants or partners to the property except us, and that the name of this village, survey number, title, limit, boundaries, etc. are correct.
All these things are told to you and make you believe and give you confidence and write this settlement deed in your name on this day and give it to you.
The Scheduled Property is hereby registered in your name with the agreements.
The Scheduled Property is not an assigned property under A.P. Act No. 9/1977. Photostat copies of all records relating to the above mentioned property are hereby furnished to you as vouchers.
The Scheduled Property is a land parcel of land in Karapa Mandal, Kongodu Gram Panchayat Area, Kongodu Village Taluk, Survey No. 149-2, 108.88 sq. m. or 91.03 sq. m., formerly East Godavari District, now Kakinada District, under the Sub-Registrar of Tallarevu. The property is situated on a plot of land with a newly constructed R.C.C. basement (400 sq m plinth area) measuring and bounding: East: 28.0 sq m or West: 28.0 sq m or North: 35.0 sq m or South: 35.0 sq m or 8.53 sq m or 8.53 sq m or 10.6 We have taken physical possession of your property, including its newly constructed R.C.C. basement, electricity service connection, electrical fittings, doors, gates, windows etc., common roads, water resources and all other rights of way, on this day. 1.P. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 424 of 2026 dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by 1. Pulapakura Venkataramana, 2.Mulaparthi Dhanalakshmi, 3. Kunche Durga, in favour, Pulapakura Venkataramana, (whereas donee is brother of 2nd and 3rd donor & Donee representing himself as 1st Donor) towards the property admeasuring an extent of 108.88Sq.Yds, located near by house no.1-53, comprised in survey number 149-2. situated in Kongodu Village and Gram Panchayath, Karapa Mandal erstwhile East Godavari District, now within the District of Kakinada, registered at Sub-Registrar Office, Tallarevu(412) is bounded as follows: North by: 35.0 ft or 10.66 mts – Land and house of Kunche Prasad. South by: 35.0 ft or 10.66 mts – Land and house of Ooda Veerababu. East by: 28.0 ft or 8.53 mts – Panchayat road. West by: 28.0 ft or 8.53 mts – Pantabodi
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:: 1. It should be noted that the deed is executed by Donor No.1 representing himself as the Donee, thereby acting in a dual capacity, which constitutes a conflict of interest and is legally invalid. Therefore, it is advisable for the F.I. to verify the same and proceed as per its internal policy. 2. It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
